p.span: The context is an 'Anomaly Driven' context. Crossover points (boundaries) where data becomes more anomalous than normal, or more normal than anomalous are derived from a search.

index=demographics | stats count(Height) as count min(Height) as min perc30(Height) as anomalous_normal perc70(Height) as normal_anomalous max(Height) as max | xsCreateADContext name=Height app=search container=JUNK scope=search terms="anomalous,normal,anomalous" endshape="curve" shape="trapezoid" notes="junk" read="*" uom="inches" write="*"
Creates an Anomaly Driven context having crossover points at 30% and 70% with 3 terms (anomalous,normal,anomalous) using curve for endshapes and s-trapezoid for the center shape.
app, class, container, endshape, name, notes, read, scope, search, shape, terms, type, uom, write
The application to store this context.
A comma separated list of classes.
The container to store the context.
The shape of the end concepts. This defaults to curve.
A legal string which specifies the name by which the created Context will be known.
A description of the context. This defaults to 'none'.
Read permissions (i.e., roles) . This defaults to * (for all roles).
Save the context after it is created. The default value is "true". To turn off save, set save=false.
Where to save the context (private, app, or application name). This defaults to global.
The search string used to generate data
The shape of the middle concepts. This defaults to s-trapezoid.
A comma delimited set of legal strings which define the names of the terms within the Context. Must be 3 terms.
domain - the default, centers the set on (max-min)/2 and scales the context to cover the whole domain
Write permissions (i.e., roles) . This defaults to * (for all roles).
The context created by xsCreateADContext is displayed in table or chart format. See xsDisplayContext for details about display of the created Context.
